intro: Nassauvia aculeata, commonly known as the prickly nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Nassauvia aculeata is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
